description:
The "boot" and "list" commands in nova don't seem to be sequentially consistent. Doing performance testing on the latest openstack code, I occasionally observe that the instance is not in the output of "nova list". If I re-request the list a moment later, the instance is almost always there (i.e., "show" and "list" are eventually consistent).

Note that above, when I saw "nova ...", I'm not using the command-line nova client tool. Instead, I'm issuing the requests from the same process with the same novaclient.client.Client instance. The delay between invocations of the nova command-line tool would hide the race I'm observing.

I observe this problem fairly rarely; roughly once per 100 instances booted.

My suspicion is that the inconsistency arises from how nova-api interacts with the database. Thus it's pertinent to note that I'm running with 20 osapi workers.

I'm using mysql.
title: instances occasionally do not exist in `nova list` immediately after boot

comments.content:
The "boot" and "show" commands in nova don't seem to be sequentially consistent. Doing performance testing on the latest openstack code, I occasionally observe "nova show X" requests fail (HTTP 404) after "nova boot" returns the id X. If I repeat the failing requests a moment later, they almost always succeed (i.e., "show" and "boot" are eventually consistent).

Note that above, when I saw "nova ...", I'm not using the command-line nova client tool. Instead, I'm issuing the requests from the same process with the same novaclient.client.Client instance. The delay between invocations of the nova command-line tool would hide the race I'm observing.

I observe this problem fairly rarely; roughly once per 100 instances booted.

My suspicion is that the inconsistency arises from how nova-api interacts with the database. Thus it's pertinent to note that I'm running with 20 osapi workers.

I'm using mysql.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~pete5

comments.content: Note: I was using "nova list", not "nova show", so I updated the title and bug description.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~pete5

comments.content: Nevermind, this was my client-side bug. I was coalescing 'nova list' requests from different threads without regard to other requests those threads may have made to nova-api (e.g., boot).
